text: Euphorbia discoidalis, commonly known as summer spurge, is a flowering plant. A dicot, it grows across parts of the southern United States. It reaches about in height and has white flowers in the late summer and early fall. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae (spurge) family and the genus Euphorbia. ==References== discoidalis Category:Euphorbia stubs Category:Taxa named by Alvan Wentworth Chapman
title: Euphorbia discoidalis
